## Sets

::: fragment
-   Definition: Collection of elements
:::

::: fragment
-   Types: Finite, infinite, countable, uncountable, bounded, unbounded
:::

::: fragment
$$
\mathbb{N} = \{0, 1, 2, \ldots\} \quad \text{(Natural numbers)}
$$
:::

::: fragment
$$
\mathbb{Z} = \{\ldots, -2, -1, 0, 1, 2, \ldots\} \quad \text{(Integers)}
$$
:::

::: fragment
$$
\mathbb{Q} = \left\{\frac{a}{b} \mid a, b \in \mathbb{Z}, b \neq 0 \right\} \quad \text{(Rational numbers)}
$$
:::

::: fragment
$$
\mathbb{R} = \text{All rational and irrational numbers} \quad \text{(Real numbers)}
$$
:::

## Set Notation

::: fragment
-   Element of a set: ( x \in A )
:::

::: fragment
-   Subset: ( A \subset B )
:::

::: fragment
-   Proper subset: ( A \subsetneq B )
:::

::: fragment
-   Cardinality: Number of elements in a set
:::

::: fragment
$$
A = \{1, 2, 3\}, \quad B = \{1, 2, 3, 4\}
$$
:::

::: fragment
$$
A \subset B, \quad |A| = 3, \quad |B| = 4
$$
:::

## Operations on Sets

::: fragment
-   Difference: $A \setminus B$ (read “A diﬀerence B”)
:::

::: fragment
-   Complement: $A^c$
:::

::: fragment
-   Intersection: $A \cap B$
:::

::: fragment
-   Union: $A \cup B$
:::

::: fragment
-   Cartesian product: $A \times B$
:::

::: fragment
$$
A = \{1, 2, 3\}, \quad B = \{2, 3, 4\}
$$
:::

::: fragment
$$
A \setminus B = \{1\}, \quad A^c = \{x \mid x \notin A\}
$$
:::

::: fragment
$$
A \cap B = \{2, 3\}, \quad A \cup B = \{1, 2, 3, 4\}
$$
:::

::: fragment
$$
A \times B = \{(1,2), (1,3), (1,4), (2,2), (2,3), (2,4), (3,2), (3,3), (3,4)\}
$$
:::

## Levels of Measurement

::: fragment
-   Nominal: Categories without order (e.g., gender)
:::

::: fragment
-   Ordinal: Ordered categories (e.g., rankings)
:::

::: fragment
-   Interval: Ordered categories with equal intervals (e.g., temperature in Celsius)
:::

::: fragment
-   Ratio: Interval scale with a meaningful zero (e.g., height, weight)
:::

::: fragment
$$
\text{Nominal: } \{ \text{Male, Female} \}
$$
:::

::: fragment
$$
\text{Ordinal: } \{ \text{Low, Medium, High} \}
$$
:::

::: fragment
$$
\text{Interval: } \{ \text{0°C, 10°C, 20°C} \}
$$
:::

::: fragment
$$
\text{Ratio: } \{ \text{0 kg, 10 kg, 20 kg} \}
$$
:::
